settings.page_text: MADE BY NATURE, NOT BY RULES

settings.title: SUSTAINABILITY
settings.feature-subheading:
Our mission is to create a whisky which can exist in harmony with this planet we call home. Certified organic and made using 100% renewable energy; sustainability for us is a way of life, not just an afterthought.

Find out more about sustainability

settings.title: METHOD
settings.feature-subheading:
We’re young and independent and this gives us the freedom to experiment. Our passion is for the spirit - the alchemy and complexity of distillation - and we’re not afraid to colour outside the lines.

Find out more about our method

settings.title: MISSION
settings.feature-subheading:
Annabel started Nc’nean to change the way the world thinks about whisky from Scotland. She left her job in London in 2013 and set about building the distillery from scratch on a wild west coast estate.

Find out more about our mission

settings.heading: ANNABEL THOMAS

Founder and CEO

London girl. Lover of wild places. Caught the whisky bug, built a distillery. Our very own Neachneohain.

settings.heading: GORDON WOOD

Spent 23 years with one of the giants of the industry. Loves the west coast. Bringing it all together at Nc’nean. Has a life goal to get to work by boat one day.

settings.heading: LORNA DAVIDSON

Came to Drimnin from the east. Has taken to distilling like a duck to water. Often found trying to grow things under the stills. The queen of our spirits.

settings.text_body: Annabel started Nc’nean to change the way the world thinks about whisky from Scotland. Her mission was to create a whisky which could exist in harmony with this planet we call home. After leaving her job in London in 2013, she spent four years raising funds and building the distillery from the ground up on the west coast of Scotland. We’ve been distilling since 2017 and in 2020 we launched our first ever whisky. We hope you love it as much as we do.

Sustainability runs in our veins. We believe it is our responsibility to constantly improve our impact on this earth in terms of carbon footprint, pollution and biodiversity. We use organic Scottish barley in a distillery powered by renewable energy and recycle 99.97% of our waste. We bottle our whisky in a 100% recycled clear glass bottle (a first in Scotch whisky, we think). Find out more about sustainability and how it drives us here.

A philosophy, a way of looking at the world, a curiosity, a willingness to try. Out of this approach, our first two products were born - our Botanical Spirit and our even more adventurous Aged Botanical. Simply asking ‘why’ or ‘what if’ was also the start of our yeast experiments at the distillery: the realisation that most distilleries in Scotland use the same yeast because it produces the highest yield of alcohol.

The inspiration for our name, Neachneohain, was an ancient Gaelic goddess. She was known as the Queen of Spirits and a fierce protector of nature. Strong and independent, she was never afraid to walk her own path. We try to follow her ethos in everything we do.

settings.title: MADE BY NATURE NOT BY RULES
settings.page_text: We are an independent, organic whisky distillery that exists to create experimental spirits and pioneer sustainable production

settings.title: A LIGHTBULB MOMENT
settings.feature-subheading: Text columns are great for displaying key features of a product or the steps that are performed after a purchase (ie. packaging, shipping, tracking).

settings.title: BUILDING THE DISTILLERY
settings.feature-subheading: Text columns are great for displaying key features of a product or the steps that are performed after a purchase (ie. packaging, shipping, tracking).

settings.title: OUR FIRST WHISKY
settings.feature-subheading: Text columns are great for displaying key features of a product or the steps that are performed after a purchase (ie. packaging, shipping, tracking).

settings.title: ORGANIC
settings.feature-subheading: Our most important raw ingredient is farmed organically, and that means it is produced in the most natural way possible, by farmers who don’t use artificial pesticides or fertilisers. This not only results in massive biodiversity, but also better soil health and water quality.

settings.title: SCOTTISH
settings.feature-subheading: Our barley is all Scottish. We can’t grow it on the west coast, because of the more rugged terrain and wet winters, so instead we buy from two farmers located in the east, one in Aberdeenshire and one in Fife. The best bit? The organic barley we source has a 42% lower carbon footprint that average conventional barley.

settings.title: CERTIFIED
settings.feature-subheading: When a product is labelled as organic, it means that its ingredients and processes have been through a rigorous certification process. We are certified by the Biodynamic Association who inspect us every year to ensure we conform to organic standards. Click here to view our BDA Certificate.

settings.title: ORGANIC CERTIFIED
settings.subheading: By drinking one bottle of our organic spirit you are securing two square metres of biodiversity and soil health.

settings.heading: OUR SCOTTISH BARLEY
settings.subheading: Fully organic, with a 42% lower carbon footprint than average conventional barley

settings.title: ENERGY
settings.feature-subheading: Our distillery production footprint is naturally very low due to our use of 100% renewable energy. Our two copper pot stills are powered solely by our biomass boiler using wood chip from the local forest for its power; all the trees that are harvested are replanted. We source a very small amount of low carbon electricity from our green energy partners, Engie. Engie are a global supplier of low-carbon energy who are committed to accelerate the transition towards a carbon-neutral world.

settings.title: FOOTPRINT
settings.feature-subheading: The combination of this green electricity and our biomass energy means that our footprint for distillery production alone is a minute 26.5 tonnes of CO2 per annum. Together with all the emissions associated with our supply chain, our total carbon footprint for a whole year is less than one return plane journey from London to New York. In 2021-22 our carbon footprint per bottle produced went down, from 1.87kg Co2e per bottle, to 1.74kg Co2e.

settings.title: OFFSETTING
settings.feature-subheading:
To achieve our net zero status for distillery operations, we have partnered with Highland Carbon to offset our remaining few carbon emissions. We do this via a sustainable forest planting project with a verified carbon standard hallmark.

If you fancy getting in to the nitty gritty of everything we do, you can read our full sustainability report here.

settings.title: NET ZERO
settings.subheading: We are now officially verified as net zero carbon emissions from our own distillery operations (scope 1 and 2) by Environmental Strategies Limited, confirming that the few emissions we produce whilst distilling are less than the amount which we have removed from the atmosphere.

settings.title: FIND US
settings.feature-subheading:
Nc’nean Distillery, Drimnin,
By Lochaline, PA80 5XZ. 
Click here for directions

settings.page_text: An experimental journey to create forward thinking whisky for the modern drinker. Light, clean and delicious spirits.

settings.text_body: Malted barley, yeast and water. Only three ingredients but a world of possible flavours. Our whisky spirit is made from 100% organic Scottish barley, whose low yields result in concentrated flavour and whose farming practices encourage biodiversity and soil health. Yeast is magical and complex, responsible for developing so many of the flavours in our spirit. We use two varieties for our house style: one creates fruity flavours, the other is a more traditional distilling yeast.

We are spirit nuts. Yes, maturation is critical to our whisky, but our passion is really for the spirit that comes straight off the still. Everything we do is designed to achieve our trademark pure, fruity unaged spirit (called ‘new make’). Our malted barley is mashed slowly, fermented slowly and distilled slowly. The malted barley spends an hour resting for flavour development and another 20 minutes being filtered through the husks for purity. We ferment for up to 114 hours. We collect only the purest, fruitiest part of our spirit distillation. Unlike many other whisky distilleries we run different spirit recipes at different times of year, depending on what we envisage bottling at the end of maturation. We mature in a range of casks, predominantly specially treated red wine and American whiskey barrels to develop depth and sweetness.

A philosophy, a way of looking at the world, a curiosity, a willingness to try. From the development of our completely unique Botanical Spirit in partnership with Heriot-Watt University and our friends at Beinn an Tuirc, to our yeast experiments, asking why? or what if? has been the start of them all. The more we work with yeast, the more fascinated we become and each new experiment is another great adventure. Our trials of rum yeast (that is yeast that was originally developed to be used by rum distilleries) produced wonderful pineapple aromas in our spirit; blackberries and plums were produced by a red wine yeast. It will be a while yet until any of these experiments make it into a bottle, but we’re keeping a close eye on their development.

Dr. Jim Swan was involved with Nc’nean from the beginning. He helped design our distillery, our house style and our maturation approach. A legend in the world of whisky, he was instrumental in helping many of the new distilleries we admire around the world establish their fantastic whiskies. Jim died suddenly in February 2017, just as we were commissioning the distillery. We were lucky to have had his guidance and he is sorely missed. We often wonder what he would have made of our yeast trials, of our Botanical spirit, and now of our whisky.

His work is being continued by our small team of distillers, the majority of whom are new to making whisky. Click here to meet them.
Info on how to get here and where to stay.

settings.title: GETTING HERE
settings.feature-subheading:
You can reach us by land or by sea. If you fancy taking a slow adventure on land, there are instructions on how to reach us via public transport here. 

If you are planning to visit us by ferry or water taxi from Mull, Oban or XXX, there are various options which you can see here (link to boat info PDF). If you are coming on your own boat we have a mooring for boats in a beautiful bay below the distillery. It is suitable for boats up to 45ft to use at your own risk. If you’d like to use the mooring please call us, or there are pontoons in Lochaline (a 30 minute drive away).

settings.title: WHERE TO STAY
settings.feature-subheading:
If you fancy staying on the doorstep, Achnacriche Bed and Breakfast is within walking distance of the distillery. If you are looking to stay longer than a couple of nights then there are weekly holiday lets nearby too. Click here to find out more.

West Highland Peninsulas and Fort William Accommodation both have a good lists of places to stay outside of Drimnin. Wherever you stay, remember to book nice and early as places tend to get booked up fairly quickly.

settings.title: ABOUT THE AREA
settings.feature-subheading: Text columns are great for displaying key features of a product or the steps that are performed after a purchase (ie. packaging, shipping, tracking). Text columns are great for displaying key features of a product or the steps that are performed after a purchase (ie. packaging, shipping, tracking). Text columns are great for displaying key features of a product or the steps that are performed after a purchase (ie. packaging, shipping, tracking).

settings.title: VISIT OUR DISTILLERY
settings.text:
Tucked away in the Highlands of Scotland, we’ve been named as one of the top 10 Scottish distilleries to visit by The Guardian and unmissable by The Spirits Business.

OPENING  TIMES
Tours run Monday – Friday at 10am and 2pm. They take approximately two hours and include an alcohol free option. During the winter months we may be offering reduced tour availability. We also offer private tours - you can find out more about all options by clicking the book button below.

Our distillery shop is open every day 10 – 5, please call ahead to let us know that you would like to visit. All distillery visits are by appointment only. The distillery is not open on weekends, but our spirits can be purchased locally from Lochaline stores, Hebridean lodge on Mull, Keystores in Strontian, and the Post Office in Kilchoan.

Adult distillery tour: £18 per person // Alcohol free tour: £12 per person // Children under 12: £6 per person
Private tours: £50 per person (minimum four persons)

settings.heading: GETTING HERE
settings.subheading: You can reach us by land or by sea. If you fancy taking a slow adventure on land, there are instructions on how to reach us here, including via public transport. If you are planning to visit us by sea, you can get to us via the Calmac Ferry from Oban and Mull, or if you are coming on your own boat we have two moorings in a beautiful bay below the distillery. They are suitable for boats up to 45ft, and can be used for day visits and at your own risk. There are also pontoons in Lochaline (a 30 minute drive away), which we may be able to offer transport to and from. If you’d like to use the mooring, or want more info on transport please get in touch.

settings.heading: WHERE TO STAY
settings.subheading:
If you want to take full advantage of being as local as possible to the distillery, there’s a B&B and a selection of self-catering cottages on Drimnin Estate. In the village of Drimnin there are also a number of other self-catering facilities - we recommend The Mill Steadings. The main village on the Morvern peninsular is Lochaline, just 12 miles away, where you can find a hotel which serves evening meals, self-catering cottages, a restaurant and B&B’s. For those people wanting a highland adventure that doesn’t cost the earth we recommend Highland Basecamp, an eco-conscious hostel with private en-suite bunk rooms and a self catering kitchen.

Some more information about the area and accommodation
options can be found via West Highland Peninsulas and Fort William Accommodation websites.

settings.title: OUR HOME: THE MORVERN PENINSULA
settings.text:
The distillery is located on the beautiful and wild Drimnin Estate which offers long stretches of coastline, well sign-posted walks and plenty of wildlife spotting opportunities (including White Tailed and Golden Eagles, Scottish Wildcat, Pine Martens and Otters).
There is also the Hayman gallery which is a must see if you are visiting the distillery.

The Morvern peninsular offers a wonderful array of walks and outdoor adventure opportunities. Here is a map of our favourite walks in the area - when you book in for a tour you can ask our visitor manager Amy for more details. Bikes, canoes, kayaks and paddleboards can be hired from Highland Basecamp for people wanting to get off the beaten track.

Visitors can also arrange for bespoke, guided tour experiences that include plant identification walks, skippered boat hire, diving, hill walking or wild camping in conjunction with local outdoor activity providers. Please contact Amy at tours@ncnean.com for
more details.

settings.title: BATCH TRANSPARENCY
settings.subheading:
Our experimental nature makes for varying batches. Each batch is small and will taste slightly different to the one before. We like to call it whisky freedom. Some distilling dates are not specified in line with Scotch Whisky laws.

All our whisky is non-chill filtered and is not coloured.

settings.title: WATER RECYCLING
settings.feature-subheading: 90% of the water that we use is for cooling the vapour as it comes off the stills. We recycle this rainwater via our natural cooling pond pictured below. This means that we can use the same water over and over, and we don’t need to use energy to cool it down, or chemicals to keep it clean.

settings.title: WATER EFFICIENCY
settings.feature-subheading: Even though the west coast is very wet, climate change has led to prolonged dry spells (often in the spring and early summer). To make sure that we don’t put unnecessary pressure on our water resources, we are constantly measuring our water usage, and looking at ways to be more water efficient.

settings.title: SPRING WATER
settings.feature-subheading: All the water that we use for making our whisky comes from a spring just behind the distillery. Our own source, it is beautifully clean and requires no treatments, chlorine or otherwise, before use.

settings.title: ZERO WASTE TO LANDFILL
settings.feature-subheading: Nc’nean is a zero waste distillery. In 2021 we diverted 99.97% of all of our waste from landfill. We also focus on the reuse of materials so we can lessen the amount of waste that we send for recycling.

settings.title: RETURNING WASTE TO THE LAND
settings.feature-subheading: Our biggest source of waste is our pot ale - the liquid which is left after distilling - which we spread on the local farmland as fertiliser. Making whisky also creates draff, or leftover barley, which provides a tasty meal for the cows on the farm.

settings.title: CHEMICAL FREE
settings.feature-subheading: Natural waste is one thing, but chemical waste is a whole different matter. If used, it can very easily end up causing damage to the surrounding environment, so we focus on sourcing natural cleaning products for our bar, office and loos.

settings.title: REDUCE
settings.feature-subheading: We are actively reducing the amount of virgin materials that we use for our production. Our whisky is bottled in a 100% recycled clear glass bottle, requiring no virgin sand and reducing the carbon footprint by 40%. Our gift packaging is made here in the UK from 90% recycled cardboard, and all orders from our website are shipped in recycled cardboard boxes.

settings.title: REUSE
settings.feature-subheading: It takes a lot of energy to make glass (even the recycled kind), so to make sure that it’s not just single use, we are devising ways for you to refill, reuse and upcycle your bottles. We’ve given you a couple of ideas below, but keep an eye out on our blog for more upcycling tips.

settings.title: RECYCLE
settings.feature-subheading: To close the loop, we will make sure that our packaging can be recycled or composted when it comes to the end of its usable life. If you aren’t going to give your packaging a new life at home, then please remember to pop any of our bottles and boxes in your household recycling.

settings.heading: SIMON HEWITT
settings.subheading:
Distiller

Trained as a chef. Has walked the length of New Zealand and of North America. Picked up some bee-keeping skills along the way. Now turning his hand to distilling.

settings.heading: AMY STAMMERS
settings.subheading:
Visitor Manager

Free spirited Norfolk girl with a passion for all things environmental. Made a beeline to work with us. Likes trying to get lost, and finding her way to a local pub for refuge.

settings.heading: KAT PRESLEY
settings.subheading:
UK Sales Manager

Born and grew up in Thailand and spends a lot of time trying to cook Thai Food as good as her mothers. Plays hockey, runs and hikes, and fell in love with whisky back in 2011.

settings.heading: SASHA HOLT
settings.subheading:
Head of Marketing

Farmer’s daughter, big foodie. Based in London but her Scottish ties make her feel at home with us. Idea of a good time includes a hike and a pair of skis.

settings.heading: MATT HASTINGS
settings.subheading:
Brand Ambassador and Blender

Descended from a line of publicans. Loves running, can fly drones, makes awesome videos. Via running one of London’s great whisky bars, is now our first ever Brand Ambassador.

settings.heading: SARAH HEWITT
settings.subheading:
Distiller

Lover of wildlife and really good food. After living in a tent for over a year (not her idea) had to settle somewhere wild, so Drimnin (and the Nc’nean ethos) was perfect.

settings.title: LOCAL BOTANICALS
settings.feature-subheading: We are very lucky to be located in an area where nature’s bounty is plentiful, so naturally, we use this as inspiration for our recipes. Our Botanical Spirit includes bog myrtle, wild thyme, sorrel and heather, all found locally to the distillery

settings.title: CERTIFIED WILD
settings.feature-subheading: For our botanical spirit to be certified organic, we have to use botanicals that are also organic. For those that are handpicked by us, we ensure that they are picked in areas where there is no application of fertilisers or chemicals.

settings.title: HARVEST WITH CARE
settings.feature-subheading: To make sure that we always have enough of the things we need, and to make sure we leave enough for others, we take care with our harvesting. We monitor how much we pick from each area and how we treat each plant to ensure that we don’t damage them.

settings.heading: THE CATTLE
settings.subheading: The hungry customers who help us use our waste in the most efficient way.

settings.heading: FORESTS
settings.subheading: Our source of energy. Nature we rely on.

settings.heading: NATURE KEEPING US COOL
settings.subheading: Our natural water cooling pond.

settings.heading: MEET THE TEAM
settings.subheading: The quiet rebels

settings.heading: WHISKY FOR YOUR VALENTINE?
settings.subheading: A bottle of our single malt has a 71% lower carbon footprint than a bunch of red roses. And you can drink it too.

settings.heading: DRINK OUR SPIRITS
settings.subheading: Simple serves and delicious cocktail recipes.

settings.heading: HELLO
settings.subheading:
Welcome to our home from home. I started Nc’nean to change the way the world thinks about whisky from Scotland. To create light and delicious spirits which can exist in harmony with this planet we call home. Creative and curious, we are not afraid to walk our own path. Certified as a B Corp and verified net zero for scopes 1 & 2, we use organic Scottish barley and bottle our whisky in the UK's first 100% recycled clear glass bottle. We can’t wait to hear what you think of our spirits.

Annabel x

settings.heading: QUEEN OF SPIRITS
settings.subheading: Our name is an abbreviation of Neachneohain, known as the Queen of Spirits in Gaelic legend, and our guiding star. She was a huntress, a fierce protector of nature and never afraid to walk her own path. We try to follow this ethos in everything we do.

settings.heading: YOUR NC'NEAN CASK
settings.subheading: Thanks for your interest in our private cask programme. We are sold out of private casks and the waiting list has been closed.

settings.heading: YOUR NC'NEAN CASK
settings.subheading:
Join us on our journey by owning your own cask of our organic whisky. Each year we’ve offered 60 casks for sale to individuals or groups of friends or family. This is your chance to be involved in the founding of a new distillery. 

Your cask will be matured on the beautiful West Coast of Scotland giving you the perfect excuse to visit us. We offer a choice of 3 cask types, and prices start from £3000 for a barrel that will eventually give you over 300 bottles of organic single malt scotch whisky. Scroll down to make an enquiry for more information below.

settings.heading: KETH MCLELLAND
settings.subheading:
Head of Finance

Loves the great outdoors, exploring and Scotland so much that she’s named one of her children after one of the Hebridean Islands! Also has a reassuring love for numbers.

settings.heading: AMBER MORRISON
settings.subheading:
Export National Account Manager

Based in London, and lived in Berlin not so long ago, but the Hebrides really has her heart. Grew up surrounded by racehorses, and even rode in a race once! Loves to cook and most of all travel. Handy as our Export Manager!

settings.heading: TORRAN MEALAND
settings.subheading:
Bottler

Local chap who feels his best when at sea. Loves exploring nearby festivals, a favourite being Tiree in in the Inner Hebrides. Only claim to fame is featuring in an episode of Balamory.

settings.title: WHISKY SIX
settings.page_text: Delicious, light and refreshing. Our favourite way to drink our Organic Single Malt. Have a little scroll to find out how to make one and what else we’re up to this November.

settings.title: WHISKY SIX SOCIAL
settings.text: Welcome to our new series, the Whisky Six Social! A sequence of interviews where Annabel chats to guests over a Whisky Six about not following the rules and the spirit of doing things differently.

settings.heading: ED SMITH
settings.subheading: Annabel chats to food writer Ed Smith about why he left his city job to pursue a career in food.

settings.heading: NESS KNIGHT #2
settings.subheading: Annabel chats in more detail to explorer and conservationist, Ness, about her adventures.

settings.heading: NESS KNIGHT
settings.subheading: Annabel chats to explorer and conservationist, Ness, about expeditions, sustainability and not following the rules.

settings.heading: SIGNE JOHANSEN
settings.subheading: Annabel chats to food and drink author Signe, about the inspiration behind both her cook and cocktail books.

settings.heading: PAUL BROWN
settings.subheading: Annabel chats to founder of Bol Foods, Paul Brown, about his dream to create a positive movement in the food world.

settings.heading: JULIUS ROBERTS
settings.subheading: Annabel chats to chef turned farmer Julius Roberts about his journey to self-sufficiency.

settings.title: CAREERS
settings.text:
Our small team is growing quickly, so we are always on the lookout for new talent. We will post any formal job vacancies that we have here and on social media, so please follow us on facebook or Instagram and Linkedin to stay up to date.

We are currently looking for an awesome Head of Commerical to turbo-charge our commercial strategy and results over the next few years. The role would be responsible for Nc’nean’s UK and international sales efforts from writing the strategy to execution. Our model of a direct sales team in the UK and working with distributors abroad gives this role plenty of geographical breadth and challenges and the role will lead on our expansion to the US. For more information, click here.

Nc’nean Distillery Limited is committed to creating a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe that a diverse team helps us succeed and take active steps to help us recruit and nurture this diversity. For example, we ‘blind’ screen all job applicants, run an internship for women who are interested in working in the whisky industry (who are typically under-represented) and run training and team building events to help the team understand each other.

settings.heading: THE BLOOPER REEL
settings.subheading: At attempt to make you giggle with behind the scenes footage from a week of filming.

settings.heading: DOUGLAS TAYLOR
settings.subheading:
Bottler

Brought up in Lochaline just a few miles down the road. Big lover of the outdoors, especially the alps where he lived for a couple of winter seasons. Has a side hustle making traditional Scottish knives.

settings.heading: JESSYE FAULKNER
settings.subheading:
Operations Executive

An Irish girl who can always be found with a cup of tea in her hands. Loves being outside and wild swimming. Grew up in the Middle East, and always excited by trying new foods.

settings.heading: BEC CHADWICK
settings.subheading:
Office Manager

Originally from Sydney, Bec came to the UK for a few months and three years later she’s still here! Has worked on a winery, loves wild camping and cold water swimming which puts her in good stead living in Drimnin.

settings.title: WE ARE A CERTIFIED B CORP
settings.text:
Putting our planet, and all of us who call it home, on equal terms with profit

We are chuffed to say, after a lengthy and rigorous process, that in January 2022 we officially became a B Corporation. We joined just a few hundred other UK companies who, like us, believe in doing business responsibly and in putting social and environmental duties on equal terms with profit.

But what exactly is a B Corp? The B Corp certification is awarded to companies who have met extremely high social and environmental standards, representing their commitment to goals outside of simply trying to make money. It is awarded by the not-for-profit organisation B Lab who believe all businesses should be used as a force for good. The B stands for 'benefit' and the B Lab certifies in the way FLOCERT certifies fair trade products or Biodynamic Association certifies organic.

settings.heading: OUR SCORE: 135.6
settings.subheading:
We were delighted to receive an incredibly high score of 135.6, with major points being awarded in the environmental impact area. In the UK, the average score for a B Corp certified business is 88, with the median score of an ‘ordinary business’ currently at 50.9.

We are excited to join the growing number of B Corp certified businesses in the UK. As well as continuing to identify areas where we can improve, our next mission is to inspire others to go through the same certification process - to learn how to improve their social and environmental business practices.

settings.heading: STEWARDS OF THE EARTH
settings.subheading:
We were awarded over 70 points for our innovative efforts to protect the planet. High scores were given for things like our water recycling system, having a low carbon footprint for our manufacturing, our use of 100% recycled glass for our whisky bottles and reducing our use of chemicals on site by over
50%.

But B Corp isn’t just about nature, the process looks at governance, the community and people too. Donating to charity following our 2020 auction and engaging shareholders in environmental and social KPIs are examples of practices which also contributed to our score.

To find out about our score in more detail click here.

settings.title: OUR INTERNSHIP FOR WOMEN
settings.text:
This spring we are running our week-long internship with the mission of encouraging more women to consider careers in the whisky industry. The week will give two women the chance to experience all aspects of a working distillery, from fermentation to distillation, as well as foraging, bartending, and blending. The candidates will also have further access to marketing and sales mentorship after their week at the distillery if they are keen to understand more of that side of the business.

One of the spots has already been filled through our gender diversity in distilling partnership with Whisky Auctioneer and Heriot Watt University, so we are launching the below application to fill the second space. The internship will be unpaid, but accommodation on the beautiful and wild Morvern peninsula will be provided for the entire week.

To apply you must:
- Identify as female
- Be aged over 18
- Have a UK driving licence
- Live in the UK
- Have access to a car which you will need to drive to the distillery from your accommodation daily
- Be available from 22nd - 28th May 2022 (dates include allowing for travel time).

Application deadline 14:00 18th March 2022

settings.heading: EXPERIMENTAL IN NATURE
settings.subheading:
Hunting for delicious flavours, a dedication to organic barley, unusual cask varieties and yeast experiments. It’s what makes us tick. Here you can find out everything about every batch of whisky we produce. Whether that’s exactly when we bottled Batch .08 of our core expression, or which yeasts we used for our first Huntress bottling. Please note that some information on cask filling dates has been redacted as a result of legal restrictions.

Click on one of the pictures to find out more about that specific series.

settings.heading: ORGANIC SINGLE MALT
settings.subheading: Always available to buy from our website and always delicious.

settings.title: SINGLE MALT SCOTCH WHISKY
settings.text: Smooth and elegant, our core whisky is easy-going and delicious however you drink it, with flavours of citrus, peach, apricot and spice. Those lovely citrus and peach flavours come from our spirit, the spice from our STR casks and the signature body and texture comes from our 100% organic barley. Find out more about what casks we’ve used for which batch, the source of the barley, the yeast used or the date it was bottled using the dropdown menu below. You’ll find the batch number or code on the back of the neck label.

settings.title: AUTUMN SEASONAL RELEASE
settings.text: Our autumn series is all about the people who make Nc’nean what it is, about our small team of eco-conscious drinks fanatics on a mission to bring together a new generation of Scotch drinkers. We might be small, but our job is mighty, to pioneer sustainable production whilst creating innovative and delicious spirits. Each autumn, this bottling is selected by and named after one of our small team. Find out more about each bottling below.

settings.title: SINGLE CASK BOTTLINGS
settings.text: Aon means one in gaelic and represents our collection of single cask bottlings. Each cask has been hand-picked because it is delicious, unique and unrepeatable. Our single cask bottlings are often created in collaboration with partners or retailers who share our core values of innovation and sustainability. Find a bottling below.

settings.heading: AON 17-329
settings.subheading: Bottled exclusively for Selfridges

settings.heading: AON 17-257
settings.subheading: Bottled exclusively for Kirsch Import

settings.heading: AON 17-342
settings.subheading: Bottled exclusively for our website and distillery shop

settings.title: SPRING SEASONAL RELEASE
settings.text: This series is all about the ethos of discovery, of walking our own path, and is inspired by our very own Neacheohain. The Queen of Spirits in ancient Gaelic legend, a goddess of wild animals, the hills the rivers and the moon. A huntress. This series brings to light our ongoing pursuit of new flavours in whisky making - our love for innovation. Find out more about each bottling below.

settings.title: OUR MAIDEN BOTTILNG
settings.text:
Ainnir was the first whisky we ever bottled here at our small distillery on the wild west cost of Scotland. The small release of 1,320 bottes was made up of five hand-picked casks from our early distillations. The specially treated red wine and American whiskey barrels gave our spirit its signature body and sweetness, and the result is a light and fruity spirit with hints of citrus, peach, apricot and spice. Ainnir was limited to one bottle per person and sold out from our website in just 24 hours.

To celebrate, we partnered with our friends over at Whisky Auctioneer to auction off the first 10 bottles. Before the auction kicked off, we pledged to donate all the proceeds to five charities who we think do a great job at making the world a better place. The auction kicked off and we soon realised that we would be raising a little more than first anticipated, and at the time of the hammer bottle #1 had reached an incredible £41,004. Four times the previous world record of around £10,000! Just as exciting, were bottles #2 - #10 which together raised more than the first bottle. With the addition of the donation from Whisky Auctioneer, the total auction raised £92,500. You can read the full story on our blog here or learn about the liquid itself by clicking the button below.
